Description: A sherd of red pottery, perhaps from the same amphora as 23767. From the shoulder; a small part of the base of the neck is preserved on the fragment. The exterior bears part of an incised mark like a letter T, made during production.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Tell Dafana, Findspot 21, dry well south-west to the "Qasr"
Curator's comments: Johnston in Villing, A. and Schlotzhauer, U. (eds), Naukratis: Greek Diversity in Egypt, BM Research Publication 162, London., p. 28, Table 1, no. 11.
The Findspot number 21 has been scratched into the object.. See also Boston, MFA, 87.626 (Petrie, ibid., p. 64 § 61, pl. xxxiii, 10.a), London, BM, EA 23751 (deacc.), London, PM, UC 19248.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (p. 64, 66 § 61, pl. xxxiii, 10.c)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.115, p.128, p.215, p.224, pl.66)
